alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mitchell, northeastern Rooks, southern Jewell, Smith, Osborne and eastern Phillips Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 318 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Woodruff to 6 miles south of Alton to 20 miles south of Beloit. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Osborne around 335 AM CDT. Portis, Asherville, Simpson and Harlan around 345 AM CDT. Downs around 350 AM CDT. Scottsville around 355 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for north central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
